title: Transportation
description: Public transport like trams, trains and shared rides are available to use in Victoria. However, masks are mandatory while travelling and waiting at the station.

title: Mandatory Face Masks
description:
If you have COVID-19 symptoms.
While visiting hospital or care facility.
Inside the airport while arriving or leaving Melbourne.
When you or your close contacts are diagnosed with COVID-19. In such circumstance, you can leave your accommodation for permitted reasons only.
While waiting for COVID-19 test results.
While travelling in public transport and commercial passenger vehicles.

title: Traffic-light Permit System
description:
Victoria classifies regions of Australia as green, orange, or red, based on the region's COVID-19 risk. Non-Victorian residents cannot enter Victoria from a red zone.
Check the permit rules based on the regions here:
Green: Can apply for a permit and enter Victoria.
Orange: Can apply for a single-use permit and need to be tested for COVID-19 within 3 days of your arrival in Victoria and will be isolated until you get a negative report of the COVID-19 test. Testing location https://www.coronavirus.vic.gov.au/where-get-tested-covid-19.
Red: You can apply for permit only if youâ€™re Victorian resident. Otherwise, you will be fined $4957 and sent back.

title: Apply for Travel Permit
description: You can apply for permit using the following link: https://www.service.vic.gov.au/services/border-permit/Transaction#details
